00:00:02:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:02:080000.Dialogue: I don't want to watch Saturn 3. Deep Space Nine is better.

00:00:05:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:05:210000.Dialogue: How is Deep Space Nine better than Saturn 3?

00:00:09:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:09:170000.Dialogue: Simple subtraction will tell you it's six better.

00:00:18:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:18:020000.Dialogue: In what sense is that a compromise?

00:00:20:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:20:110000.Dialogue: Well, five is partway between three... Never mind.

00:00:25:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:25:030000.Dialogue: I'll tell you what. How about we go rock-paper-scissors?

00:00:28:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:28:030000.Dialogue: I don't think so. Anecdotal evidence suggests that in the game of rock-paper-scissors, players familiar with each other will tie 75 to 80% of the time due to the limited number of outcomes. I suggest rock-paper-scissors-lizard-Spock.

00:01:04:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:04:120000.Dialogue: Okay, I think I got it.

00:01:24:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:24:010000.Dialogue: Noticed the eye patch, did you? It's all part of a technique I've been studying for picking up women. You employ a visual display designed to make yourself distinctive and memorable.

00:01:36:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:36:020000.Dialogue: Oh, yes, like the male peacock with brilliant plumage or the rutting baboon with engorged hindquarters.

00:01:43:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:43:060000.Dialogue: Or in this case, the bar mitzvah boy with pinkeye.

00:01:47:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:47:040000.Dialogue: Mock me if you will, but it works. You show up at a club in something distinctive, scope out your target and toss out some negs.

00:02:04:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:04:190000.Dialogue: I got a whole list of 'em. Who wants to be my wingman?

00:02:07:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:07:230000.Dialogue: You're not gonna need a wingman. You're gonna need a paramedic.

00:02:12:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:12:090000.Dialogue: Your scooter's blocking my car. Did you get pinkeye again?

00:02:19:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:19:110000.Dialogue: Step one: she notices the eye patch.

00:02:23:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:23:000000.Dialogue: May I say, Penny, not a lot of women could look as hot as you do with such greasy hair?

00:02:36:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:36:040000.Dialogue: Just move your stupid scooter before I pick it up and throw it in the dumpster.

00:03:11:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:11:110000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, but I'm not going to watch The Clone Wars TV series until I've seen The Clone Wars movie.

00:03:18:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:18:190000.Dialogue: I prefer to let George Lucas disappoint me in the order he intended.

00:03:24:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:24:050000.Dialogue: I want to watch it now.

00:03:26:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:26:010000.Dialogue: Then I believe we've arrived at another quintessential rock-paper-scissors- lizard-Spock moment.

00:03:39:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:39:200000.Dialogue: I saw what you did there.

00:03:51:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:51:130000.Dialogue: What's wrong? - Okay, we'll be right there.

00:03:57:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:57:010000.Dialogue: Howard's at the Mars Rover lab. He says he's in trouble. Defcon 5.

00:04:00:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:00:210000.Dialogue: Defcon 5? Well, there's no need to rush.

00:04:09:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:09:190000.Dialogue: How can 5 not be worse than 1?

00:04:12:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:12:080000.Dialogue: Star Trek V worse than I.

00:04:16:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:16:020000.Dialogue: First of all, that's a comparison of quality, not intensity. Secondly, Star Trek I is orders-of-magnitude worse than Star Trek V.

00:04:23:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:23:210000.Dialogue: Are you joking? Star Trek V is the standard against which all badness is measured.

00:04:30:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:30:050000.Dialogue: Star Trek V has specific failures in writing and direction, while Star Trek I fails across the board: art direction, costuming, music, sound editing.

00:04:38:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:38:190000.Dialogue: Can we just forget I said Defcon and go?

00:04:47:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:47:020000.Dialogue: Will you at least stipulate that Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home is inarguably the best?

00:04:52:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:52:050000.Dialogue: I have three words for you: Wrath of Khan.

00:04:58:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:58:150000.Dialogue: I got the Mars Rover stuck in a ditch.

00:05:02:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:02:230000.Dialogue: On a dusty highway just outside Bakersfield. Where do you think? On Mars!

00:05:09:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:09:230000.Dialogue: Yeah, baby, I'll be right in.

00:05:14:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:14:000000.Dialogue: You brought a girl to the Mars Rover control room?

00:05:16:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:16:120000.Dialogue: Yeah, I picked her up in the bar. She's a doctor. One free barium enema, and my mother won't care she's not Jewish.

00:05:24:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:24:120000.Dialogue: Wait a minute. So the eye patch and the insults worked?

00:05:27:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:27:010000.Dialogue: No, there were three other guys with eye patches. It was a fiasco.

00:05:32:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:32:070000.Dialogue: What did work was, How'd you like to visit a secret government facility?

00:05:36:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:36:070000.Dialogue: So what exactly do you want us to do?

00:05:38:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:38:090000.Dialogue: You and Raj help me get the Rover out of the ditch and you get Stephanie out before somebody notices her. - She doesn't exactly have clearance.

00:05:42:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:42:220000.Dialogue: - Really? They don't let strange women from honky-tonks come in and play with $200 million government projects on distant planets?

00:05:50:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:50:230000.Dialogue: Yes, I was bad. Maybe she'll spank me. Can we please move on?

00:05:56:200000.Speaker: Girl
00:05:56:200000.Dialogue: It's getting late, so do I get to drive this thing or what?

00:06:00:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:00:210000.Dialogue: No. I'm sorry, but something's come up. Kind of a Mars Rover... Mars Rover can Howard come over...

00:06:11:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:11:050000.Dialogue: situation. So my friend Leonard is gonna take you home.

00:06:20:220000.Speaker: Girl
00:06:20:220000.Dialogue: - So are you a scientist like Howard?

00:06:24:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:24:040000.Dialogue: No one's a scientist like Howard.

00:06:28:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:28:020000.Dialogue: My mother is so gonna love her.

00:06:30:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:30:090000.Dialogue: How nice. Maybe they can carpool when they visit you in federal prison.

00:06:41:030000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard and the girl are kissing.
00:06:41:030000.Speaker: Girl
00:06:41:030000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I totally interrupted you. What were you saying?

00:06:45:020000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard and the girl are kissing.
00:06:45:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:45:020000.Dialogue: Just said Howard's a terrific guy. He's got a great sense of humor. He loves his mother... a lot. People say too much.

00:06:57:070000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard and the girl are kissing.
00:06:57:070000.Speaker: Girl
00:06:57:070000.Dialogue: I really like that you're such a loyal friend.

00:06:59:130000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard and the girl are kissing.
00:06:59:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:59:130000.Dialogue: Yeah, I am loyal. If you look at the big picture. Out of curiosity, did he ever have a shot with you?

00:07:12:050000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard and the girl are kissing.
00:07:12:050000.Speaker: Girl
00:07:12:050000.Dialogue: Are you insane? The guy was wearing an eye patch.

00:07:16:010000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard and the girl are kissing.
00:07:16:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:17:070000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard and the girl are kissing.
00:07:17:070000.Speaker: Girl
00:07:17:070000.Dialogue: He said that I could drive a car... on Mars.

00:07:21:100000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard and the girl are kissing.
00:07:21:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:21:100000.Dialogue: Got it. So, can I see you again?

00:07:26:230000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard and the girl are kissing.
00:07:26:230000.Speaker: Girl
00:07:26:230000.Dialogue: You're not gonna see me now.

00:07:31:220000.Scene: Leonard’s car. Leonard and the girl are kissing.
00:07:31:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:41:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:41:050000.Dialogue: Actually, I was just checking my e-mail.

00:07:44:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:44:120000.Dialogue: But, no, the Rover is not responding.

00:07:47:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:47:140000.Dialogue: I believe the appropriate metaphor here involves a river of excrement and a Native American water vessel without any means of propulsion.

00:07:55:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:55:110000.Dialogue: Hang on. There's got to be other options.

00:08:00:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:00:140000.Dialogue: But based on NASA's latest timetable, they won't get there for 35 years.

00:08:05:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:05:110000.Dialogue: Plus I understand you have to be standing next to the vehicle with your card when they arrive.

00:08:15:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:15:120000.Dialogue: - I guess we have to turn to Plan B.

00:08:17:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:17:230000.Dialogue: Erase hard drives, scrap surveillance tapes, wipe our fingerprints off every surface and run.

00:08:27:110000.Speaker: Voice from television
00:08:27:110000.Dialogue: A NASA spokesman states that due to the loss of data, they will most likely be unable to determine the cause of the Mars Rover's malfunction.

00:08:42:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:42:130000.Dialogue: Didn't you say you worked on the Mars Rover?

00:08:47:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:47:140000.Dialogue: When we first met, you said that if I went out with you, I could drive a car on Mars.

00:08:54:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:54:080000.Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about.

00:09:00:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:00:130000.Dialogue: Will you all excuse me? Leonard is subtly signaling that he'd like to talk to me in private.

00:09:06:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:06:230000.Dialogue: No. I remember specifically. You started by asking if I was from Mars because my ass was out of this world.

00:09:16:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:16:200000.Dialogue: That does sound like me, but no.

00:09:22:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:22:170000.Dialogue: Listen, I have to kinda sneak out for a while.

00:09:38:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:38:130000.Dialogue: I can't tell you that, either.

00:09:41:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:41:130000.Dialogue: You brought me in here to inform me you can't tell me where you're going and you can't tell me who might ask?

00:09:48:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:48:230000.Dialogue: Yeah, I really didn't think this through.

00:09:55:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:55:190000.Dialogue: If someone, and of course, we don't know who this would be, does ask where you've gone, what should I say?

00:10:00:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:00:210000.Dialogue: I don't know. Just tell 'em I went to the office.

00:10:03:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:03:040000.Dialogue: - Are you going to the office?

00:10:05:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:05:060000.Dialogue: Then how can I say it convincingly?

00:10:07:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:07:100000.Dialogue: Just say, Leonard went to the office.

00:10:09:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:09:160000.Dialogue: All right. Leonard went to the office.

00:10:18:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:18:060000.Dialogue: What is...? No, not like that! - Just, Leonard went to the office.

00:10:20:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:20:150000.Dialogue: - It would've worked out a lot better if you'd just told me you were going to the office.

00:10:28:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:28:030000.Dialogue: See? Why don't I believe you?

00:10:35:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:35:100000.Dialogue: I'm going out for a while.

00:10:47:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:47:190000.Dialogue: Doesn't anyone want to know where he's going?

00:10:54:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:54:010000.Dialogue: Leonard is going to the office.

00:11:18:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:18:150000.Dialogue: I'm hoping that was three different guys.

00:11:31:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:31:070000.Dialogue: You know, I'm a physicist, so... I thought about stuff.

00:11:38:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:38:010000.Dialogue: I wrote some of it down.

00:11:48:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:48:040000.Dialogue: If I knew you were waiting, I would've swallowed that lasagna whole.

00:11:54:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:54:110000.Dialogue: You've reached Dr. Stephanie Barnett. Leave a message.

00:11:59:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:59:060000.Dialogue: It's me again, Howard. If you're free Friday, maybe we could have a little something to eat at my place. My mom cooks a hell of a brisket.

00:12:13:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:13:070000.Dialogue: I've had her brisket. Melts in your mouth.

00:12:20:070000.Speaker: Steph
00:12:20:070000.Dialogue: Maybe we should think about going to the bedroom.

00:12:23:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:23:170000.Dialogue: Good idea. There's a bed in there, and I'm very, very, very pro-bed.

00:12:30:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:30:220000.Dialogue: You've reached Dr. Stephanie Barnett. Leave a message.

00:12:37:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:37:160000.Dialogue: Just want to let you know the head count for dinner Friday has gone up. My Aunt Betty and Uncle Elliot are coming in from Palm Springs. If anybody should ask, you're half-Jewish on your mother's side.

00:12:56:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:56:200000.Dialogue: Don't you think we should tell him you're not interested?

00:13:00:050000.Speaker: Steph
00:13:00:050000.Dialogue: Do you want me to stop and call him back right now?

00:13:13:010000.Speaker: Steph
00:13:13:010000.Dialogue: You've reached Dr. Stephanie Barnett. Leave a message.

00:13:21:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:21:000000.Dialogue: My cousins from Fort Lauderdale are flying in to meet you so that means we're gonna have to move the dinner to a restaurant.

00:13:28:180000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:13:28:180000.Dialogue: Tell her we're going to the Olive Garden!

00:13:33:000000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:13:33:000000.Dialogue: I have a coupon from the paper.

00:13:36:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:36:150000.Dialogue: We're not going to the Olive Garden, Ma!

00:13:41:050000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:13:41:050000.Dialogue: Mr. Bigshot with his Red Lobster.

00:13:46:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:46:090000.Dialogue: I'll call you back when we firm up the details.

00:14:07:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:07:000000.Dialogue: Well, last time you bought a new shirt was when we were dating.

00:14:09:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:09:230000.Dialogue: So what we did was in fact dating?

00:14:14:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:14:160000.Dialogue: Well, yeah, we did have a date.

00:14:16:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:16:190000.Dialogue: Exactly. Thank you. Do me a favor, tell Koothrappali that next time you see him.

00:14:33:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:33:010000.Dialogue: Doctor doctor. Surgical resident. Smart, pretty. Let me ask you something. If your friend thinks he's dating someone, but he's not because, in fact, you're dating her, does that make you a bad person? - That depends.  - On what?

00:15:02:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:02:070000.Dialogue: Well, have you slept with her yet? You dog!

00:15:28:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:28:000000.Dialogue: Really? Is that what you do when someone knocks?!

00:15:30:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:30:180000.Dialogue: Thank you. I had no idea!

00:15:35:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:35:170000.Dialogue: Hey, buddy. What brings you to my little slice of hell?

00:15:43:060000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:15:43:060000.Dialogue: You're gonna have to play outside!

00:15:49:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:49:150000.Dialogue: No one cares, Ma! So, what's up?

00:15:54:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:54:080000.Dialogue: Listen, I need to talk to you about something.

00:15:59:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:59:200000.Dialogue: Momentito. Yello. Thanks for calling me back. I was worried...

00:16:18:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:18:230000.Dialogue: No, I understand. Sure, we can be friends. Absolutely. Thanks for calling. You have a nice day, too. You are dead to me.

00:16:48:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:48:180000.Dialogue: Okay, one of us is going to have to stop putting up Spock.

00:17:09:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:09:120000.Dialogue: Howard is employing a schoolyard paradigm in which you are, for all intents and purposes, deceased.

00:17:16:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:16:130000.Dialogue: He intends to act on this by not speaking to you, feigning an inability to hear you when you speak and otherwise refusing to acknowledge your existence.

00:17:25:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:25:070000.Dialogue: That's just ridiculous. Why are you cooperating with him?

00:17:28:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:28:030000.Dialogue: I don't make the rules, Leonard.

00:17:32:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:32:020000.Dialogue: Howard, come on. I didn't plan on this. These things just happen. Usually not to me, but they do happen.

00:17:40:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:40:040000.Dialogue: Did someone just feel a cold breeze?

00:17:43:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:43:140000.Dialogue: I believe this is an extension of the death metaphor.

00:17:46:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:46:220000.Dialogue: The cold breeze is the so-called ectoplasmic issue of a disembodied soul passing by.

00:17:53:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:53:000000.Dialogue: Screw it. I'm just gonna eat the dumpling.

00:18:03:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:03:170000.Dialogue: Yes, but I don't see a better one on the horizon.

00:18:07:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:07:200000.Dialogue: If it isn't Mrs. Dead to Me.

00:18:13:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:13:190000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, you violated the terms of your metaphor by acknowledging her existence. I'm out.

00:18:20:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:20:030000.Dialogue: He just won't listen to me.

00:18:22:040000.Speaker: Steph
00:18:22:040000.Dialogue: Okay, I guess it'll just be the three of us then.

00:18:29:230000.Speaker: Steph
00:18:29:230000.Dialogue: My roommate. She just went through a really bad breakup, I thought she might like to meet somebody fun like you.

00:18:36:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:36:170000.Dialogue: Leonard, Stephanie, you're alive! It's a miracle!

00:18:43:020000.Scene: The apartment kitchen. Howard is on the phone.
00:18:43:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:43:020000.Dialogue: So, anyway, Lisa, I just wanted to tell you again how much I enjoyed the other night, and again, I'm sorry for how it ended.

00:18:52:040000.Scene: The apartment kitchen. Howard is on the phone.
00:18:52:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:52:040000.Dialogue: But again, if you could let me know about Friday. My mother needs a head count so she can know how big a brisket to get.

00:18:59:100000.Scene: The apartment kitchen. Howard is on the phone.
00:18:59:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:19:00:230000.Scene: The apartment kitchen. Howard is on the phone.
00:19:00:230000.Speaker: Howard

00:19:02:090000.Scene: The apartment kitchen. Howard is on the phone.
00:19:02:090000.Speaker: Howard

00:19:05:150000.Scene: The apartment kitchen. Howard is on the phone.
00:19:05:150000.Speaker: Voice from TV
00:19:05:150000.Dialogue: It's unclear how the Mars Rover got into the crevice, but one thing's certain: the data which it has sent back contain the first clear indications that there may have been life on Mars.

00:19:18:160000.Scene: The apartment kitchen. Howard is on the phone.
00:19:18:160000.Speaker: Voice from TV
00:19:18:160000.Dialogue: It's a scientific discovery that has staggering implications for all mankind. Unfortunately, we'll never know who's responsible.

00:19:32:060000.Scene: The apartment kitchen. Howard is on the phone.
00:19:32:060000.Speaker: Howard
